page.title: 09Communications
page.content: Most communications are made by either telephone or letter. Modern telephones have press-buttons instead of a dial.Most houses and all businesses gave a telephone. The message is carried by wires which are under-ground. The telephone rings when someone is trying to contact you. If you want to contact someone by letter, you write your message on a piece of paper,put it in an envelope with a stamp on, and put it in a post-box.The letters are taken away to be sorted by a machine. They are then sent on to their destinations. Every house and road has its own post-code. This helps with the sorting, and also helps the postman to deliver the letters to the correct houses.
